Name: Hospitals in the Netherlands (In Dutch: Ziekenhuisen in Nederland (sep 2013))
Variables: Location, organisation name and address
Data Quality/ Limitations: I cannot determine that for this dataset.
Comments: My laptop cannot open the documents in the zip-file, so I cannot determine the details/quality of the dataset. This is geographical data.

Name: COVID cases people aged 70+ (not living in care) (In Dutch: Covid-19 statistieken individuen van 70 jaar en ouder woonachtig buiten een instelling naar veiligheidsregio per datum)
Geographical Unit: Per "safety region". See https://www.rijksoverheid.nl/onderwerpen/veiligheidsregios-en-crisisbeheersing/veiligheidsregios for the actual regions.
Study Period: 01-07-2020 until 01-01-2023 (in the actual dataset it appears to start later)
Number of cases: NA (there is over 10,000 rows with the number of cases and deaths)
Variables: Region, total positive COVID cases and number of deaths
Agggregated/Individual Data: Aggregated (total number of cases and deaths per row)
Data Quality/ Limitations: There are rarely deaths, so most death-values are 0.
Comments: The dataset is specifically about 70+-year olds who do not live in care nor work. Data in Dutch.

Name: Quality of Dutch water per tap station. (In Dutch: Kwaliteit van drinkwater in Nederland (2012)
Variables: Yearly average of substances in drinkwater
Secondary or primary data: RIVM receives the data from the pump stations, so more secundary.
Agggregated/Individual Data: NA (it is about pump station of drink water)
Contact Details: Rijksinstituut voor Volksgezondheid en Milieu, geodata@rivm.nl
Data Quality/ Limitations: This data might not fit too well in our inventory, but just to be sure I will keep it in for now.
Comments: The data are only shown for when they exceed the "detection threshold". Furthermore, I could only open the data as CSV, which was very hard to read. Data in Dutch only.

Name: Academic General Practitioner Development Network (AHON)
Source: Part of Department of General Practice and Elderly Care Medicine of the University Medical Center Groningen (UMCG)
Geographical Unit: Province-level (I suppose based on their study area). AHON aims to give insight into medical care provided in general practices in the North of the Netherlands
Variables:
Data consist of medical records and national registries. The areas of information entail: Socio-demographic and economic characteristics, Health and community care services utilization
Medication and supplements, Non-pharmacological interventions and Death.
Secondary or primary data: The AHON-database routinely collects care data from affiliated registration practices in the North of the Netherlands.
Agggregated/Individual Data: Aggregated,  but according to the authors it is suitable for cross-sectional and longitudinal research.
Contact Details: One can ask for access at: can ask for access at AHON@umcg.nl. They won't give access to studies funded by a health insurance company or pharmaceutical industry.
Data Quality/ Limitations: I have no access to the data, so I cannot make statements about this.
Comments: I have linked the whole organisation, but they add pseudonymized data every three months. The AHON predescessor is RNG for 1998-2013.

Name: DUPARC (Dutch Parkinson Cohort)
Geographical Unit: I assume province level? They do not mention it.
Time Unit: They have a baseline, 1-year follow up and 3-year follow-up assessments (with the intention of an extended follow-up with three-year intervals).
Variables:
They take biological samples, imaging data and other sources to study: Socio-demographic and economic characteristics, Lifestyle and behaviours, Perception of health, quality of life, development and functional limitations, Medication and supplements, Physical measures and assessments, Laboratory measures
Cognition, personality and psychological measures and assessments and Administrative information.
Data Quality/ Limitations: The sample size is not too large, but still this could be a very interesting dataset.
Comments: I am not sure if this study would even be accesible, but I included it for now (we can always remove it later on).

Name: EUROCAT Northern Netherlands
Study Period: 1981-ongoing. Since 1997 information is also obtained via parental questionnaires and pharmacy data. Since 2010, information on non responders is also registered.
Time Unit: Not mentioned, but they do state that it is cross-sectional data.
Variables:
They take survey data, medical records and other sources to study: Socio-demographic and economic characteristics, Lifestyle and behaviours, Medication and supplements, Birth, pregnancy and reproductive health history, Non-pharmacological interventions, Death, Physical measures and assessments
Cognition, personality and psychological measures and assessments and Administrative information.
Secondary or primary data: All pregnancy outcomes are covered and information is collected on genetic testing, prenatal diagnosis and risk factors via parental questionnaires, medical records and pharmacy data.
Agggregated/Individual Data: I would guess aggregated? But I am not sure.
Data Quality/ Limitations: Very large sample size and to me it feels very applicable to our inventory (also regarding the study region).

Name: Health per neighbourhood (In Dutch: Gezondheid per wijk en buurt; 2012/2016/2020 (indeling 2020))
Variables: Region, mulitple health indicators (e.g. subjective health, movement, weight, smoking, alcohol use, physical limitations, anxiety/depression, stress, loneliness, being caregiver, volunteering and age).
Secondary or primary data: Secondary. The dataset is based on the "Gezondheidsmonitor Volwassenen en Ouderen" of GGD’en, CBS & RIVM
Comments: Data in Dutch

Name: Projections health per neighbourhood. (In Dutch: Volksgezondheid Toekomst Verkenning 2018; regiobeeld 2015-2030)
Variables: A lot of variables on health: lifestyle (e.g. smoking), care use, morbidity, subjective health, exercise, prevalence of 10 diseases/illnesses.
Secondary or primary data: In principle primary, but done in collaboration with the population projection 2019 Primos of ABF Research.
Comments: Data in Dutch

Name: Healthy life expectancy
Variables: % Subjective good health & % without physical impairments and region.
Secondary or primary data: Secundary; the data originate from CBS.
Comments: The data is from CBS, so if we also include that dataset, this one does not necessarily have to stay I suppose.

Name: Impfreport (Vaccination report)
Source: Niedersächsisches Landesgesundheitsamt (Lower Saxony State Health Office)
Variables: share of vaccinated persons for different diseases

Name: Regional Monitor Cromprehensive Wellbeing 2022 (In Dutch: Regionale Monitor Brede Welvaart 2022)
Variables: Subjective Wellbeing (0-100) , Greenhouse gas emission per capita etc. See overview of indicators used https://www.cbs.nl/nl-nl/visualisaties/regionale-monitor-brede-welvaart/beschrijving-indicatoren
Agggregated/Individual Data: aggregate (but also at municipal level, which are
Comments: Contains information on all variables. For further information see the data link and tab (In Dutch only) "Technische toelichting" & Beschrijving indicatoren

Name: Healthcare costs claims health insurance law (In Dutch: Verschillende kostensoorten)
Variables: Number of people (per age/gender/area group), costs for healthcare categories (ALL ONLY IN DUTCH)
Agggregated/Individual Data: aggregate (total healthc clames per category at health insurance companies for all individual of a specific age category per gender per ZIP-code or municipality)
Comments: Data is only available in Dutch. More information on categories in provided in: https://www.vektis.nl/uploads/Docs%20per%20pagina/Open%20Data%20Bestanden/2020/Bijsluiter%20bij%20de%20Vektis%20Open%20Databestanden%20Zorgverzekeringswet%202011%20-%202020%20.pdf

Name: Covid Health Monitor Youth 2021 (In Dutch: Corona Gezondheidsmonitor Jeugd 2021)
Geographical Unit: Postcode (ZIP-code 4 digits) OR Province (NUTS2) OR Place of Residence OR GGD-region
Variables: personal health related indicators and questions
Comments: Data is only available in Dutch.

Name: Dutch National Vaccination programme, vaccination type, region (2022 division) (In Dutch: Rijksvaccinatieprogramma; soort vaccinatie, regio (indeling 2022)
Geographical Unit: Whole of the country, GGD-regions, Municipalities (per GGD-region)
Variables: Persons, vaccinated persons, vaccination rate (in %)
Data Quality/ Limitations: Missing observations for some years since vaccination not introduced at the start of observation period.
Comments: Data is only available in Dutch

Geographical Unit: From larger regions, to COROP and municipalities.
Number of cases: Mortality counts per selected age groups
Variables: Number of deaths in which you can specify marital status, gender and age (and of course region).
Comments: Only in Dutch.

Name: Registered donors (In Dutch: Donorregistratie; regio (indeling 2019), 2014-2020)
Geographical Unit: From larger regions, to COROP and municipalities.
Time Unit: One can filter/view the data per year.
Variables: The number of (non-)registered donors, the type of consent (e.g. family decides), and the regions.
Comments: Only available in Dutch. It also appears that you cannot view multiple years simultaneously, which is quite disappointing. This dataset also does not allow to include factors such as age/gender.

Name: Medical professionals; specialization, position in the labour market, age & region (In Dutch: Medisch geschoolden; specialisme, arbeidspositie, leeftijd, woonregio)
Geographical Unit: From larger regions (provinces), to "Regioplus arbeidsmarktregio's", which appear slightly similar to the COROP regions.
Variables: Whether someone is an employee or self-employed/freelancer, several medical jobs (7 are specified), age groups (<25, 25-30, ..., >70). One can also specify whether someone receives benefits (within the "overige sociaaleconomische categorieën).
Comments: Only available in Dutch.

Name: People on medication (In Dutch: Personen met verstrekte geneesmiddelen; regio (gemeente))
Geographical Unit: Provinces, COROP, municipalities and GGD regions.
Variables: The percentage of users of several drugs per region, age and gender.
Comments: Only available in Dutch.

Name: Mortality by cause of death (In Dutch: Overledenen; belangrijke doodsoorzaken (korte lijst), regio)
Variables: 18 categories of cause of death (per region), gender and age
Comments: Only available in Dutch. There is another one as well, which distinguishes less causes, see: https://opendata-cbs-nl.proxy-ub.rug.nl/statline/#/CBS/nl/dataset/80142ned/table?ts=1685629699578. This dataset does not include age/sex, which is why I decided to include the other one here.

Name: Defaulters regarding health insurance (In Dutch: Zorgverzekeringswet; wanbetalers naar regio per 31 december)
Variables: The amount of defaulters; in absolute as well as relative numbers per region.
Secondary or primary data: I think primary? CBS got the data from: CAK; BRP and their own data, but they did not use a readily available dataset by others.
Comments: Only in Dutch, and contrary to most of CBS's datasets, there are no additional contextual variables available.

Name: Hospital admissions ISHMT (In Dutch: Ziekenhuisopnamen; diagnose-indeling ISHMT, regio)
Variables: Hospital admissions (absolute and per 10.000), admission type, diagnosis, gender and age.
Comments: ISHMT stands for: "International Shortlist for Hospital Morbidity Tabulation". There is also a dataset of VTV hospital admissions, which can be consulted here: https://opendata-cbs-nl.proxy-ub.rug.nl/statline/#/CBS/nl/dataset/84523NED/table?ts=1685631009921. VTV stands for "Volksgezondheid Toekomstverkenningen".

Name: Groningen Panel (In Dutch: Groningener Panel)
Source: Social Planning Bureau Groningen (In Dutch: sociaal planbureau groningen) (CMO-STAMM)
Time Unit: depends on topic (10 times a year)
Variables: Mental heatlh of young people, drugs in the environment of young people, broad prosperity and young people, consequences of the corona crisis, geriatric care and other care services, health literacy of seniors
Comments: Only a selection of indicators, on a given theme, can be obtained on request.Data only available in Dutch. Note, that some data comes from the CBS (aggregate level; municipality)

Name: Drenthe Panel (In Dutch; Drents Panel)
Source: Drenthe Trending Bureau (In Dutch: drents trendbureau) (CMO-STAMM)
Time Unit: depends on topic (10 times a year)
Variables: Consequences of the corona crisis, wishes and needs for elderly people living at home, living independently for longer
Comments: Only a selection of indicators, on a given theme, can be obtained on request.Data only available in Dutch. Note that there has been a previous panel called Drents parlement since 2005 which ended in 2020. Note, that some data comes from the CBS (aggregate level; municipality).

Name: Lifelines Biobank
Variables: Topics: Work, health, personality, BMI, blood pressure, lung function, cognitive abilities, blood samples, feces samples, urine samples etc....
Comments: Lifelines has contextual and health data from a panel of residents in the Northern-Netherlands. Note that there is was a COVID panel. For costs see: https://www.lifelines.nl/researcher/how-to-apply/costs-biobank-lifelines

Name: DRG - Diagnosis-Related Groups Statistics
Source: Statistische Ämter des Bundes und der Länder - Forschungsdatenzentren (Institutes for Statistics of State and Federal State - Reasearch Data Centres)

Name: KiGGS (Studie zur Gesundheit von Kindern und Jugendlichen in Deutschland; English: German Health Interview and Examination Survey for Children and Adolescents)
Variables: health data and seom sociodemographic data on people under 18 years, and those ober 18 years that participated in earlier studies

Name: Causes of death - crude death rate by NUTS 2 region of residence
Variables: Crude death rate by gender (and by cause of death)
Comments: Additional dataset on other health indicators see: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database and look for; General and regional statistics > Regional statistics by NUTS classification > Regional health statistics > Causes of death

Name: Health personnel by NUTS 2 regions - historical data (1993-2021)
Variables: Health personnel by NUTS2 region in number, per hunderd thousand inhabitants; by occupational classification (health)
Comments: Additional dataset on other health; resource and patients data see: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database and look for; General and regional statistics > Regional statistics by NUTS classification > Regional health statistics > Health care: resources and patients (non-expenditure data)

Name: NKR number (in Dutch: NKR cijfers)
Source: Integral Cancer Institute Netherlands(In Dutch: integraal Kankercentrum Nederland)
Number of cases: 1 aggregate number per area per year
Variables: Prevelance, Incidence, death, survivers (per region and/or cancer type)
Comments: Data only available in Dutch. Number of deaths comes from CBS
Topic: Not sure what NKR is but I assume cancer

Name: European health interview survey
Study Period: Waves with different year for different countries: 2006-2009 waves 1, wave 2 was 2013-2015, wave 3 was for 2019.
Variables: background variables (sex, age, education etc...), health status variables, health-care use (hospitalisation, consulation etc...), health determinants (height and weights, fruit and vegetable consumption)
Comments: Takes up to 8 weeks to get data. Contains information on region of residence (NUTS 2) but not for the Netherlands in wave 3. Similarly note that both the Netherlands and Germany are not included in wave 1. (Tim: I corrected the region from Netherlands to European Union)

Name: GEDA - Gesundheit in Deutschland aktuell (current german health)
Geographical Unit: up to municipality (depending on access type and wave)
Variables: up to 316 variables on health behaviour and health status
Access: on request, special request for regional data

Name: KiGGS - Studie zur Gesundheit von Kindern und Jugendlichen in Deutschland (Health Study on Children and Adolescents in Germany)
Geographical Unit: up to municipalitay level (depending on access type)
Variables: between approx. 500 and 1200 variables on health of children and adolescents, accompanying them into adulthood
Access: on request, special request for regional data
Comments: special wave additionally to second wave

Name: DEGS - Studie zur Gesundheit ERwachsener in Deutschland (Study on the health of adults in Germany)
Geographical Unit: up to municipality level (depending on access type)
Variables: between approx. 600 and 1000 variables on the same cohort of adults, including physical examinations
Secondary or primary data: primary (examination data should be secondary, but not sure)
Access: on request, special request for regional data

Name: LSN-Online Datenbank (LSN- Online Database)
Source: LSN - Landesamt für Statistik Niedersachsen (Federal Institute for Statistics Lower Saxony)
Variables: Type of admission, type of hospital operator, Bed capacities, Large medical-technical equipment, Drug supply, Medical and non-medical staff (from 2018 in the form of individual staff data records), Calculation and occupancy days, Patient arrivals and departures, Deliveries and births, Outpatient services (from 2018 differentiated by legal basis), Pre-, post and partial inpatient treatments as well as Participation in inpatient emergency care (from 2018). Other topics under contextual data.
Topic: general health, hospitals, medication, hospital admissions, births etc.

Name: Qualitätsberichte der Krankenhäuser (hospital quality reports)
Variables: general and structural information (e.g. personnel, services, etc.), quality of services and performance
Comments: Reports as PDF or XML files

Name: Doctors per inhabitant - MORO Project (Modellvorhaben der Raumordnung (Model project of spatial planning)
Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: Doctors per inhabitant: only federal states
Contact Details:

Name: Krankenhausbetten (hospital beds) - MORO Project (Modellvorhaben der Raumordnung (Model project of spatial planning)
Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: - Hospital beds in general hospitals (per 100,000 inhabitants)
Contact Details:

Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR)
Referat RS 3 „Europäische Raum- und Stadtentwicklung“
Telefon: +49 228 99401-2328
E-Mail: claire.duvernet@bbr.bund.de

Name: Lebenserwartung (life expectancy) - MORO Project (Modellvorhaben der Raumordnung (Model project of spatial planning)
Source: Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR) - (Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development)
Variables: Life expectancy women at birth (years), life expectancy men at birth (years)
Contact Details:
Claire Duvernet
Bundesinstitut für Bau-, Stadt- und Raumforschung (BBSR)
Referat RS 3 „Europäische Raum- und Stadtentwicklung“
Telefon: +49 228 99401-2328
E-Mail: claire.duvernet@bbr.bund.de

Name: Corona-Datenplattform (Corona-Data Platform)
Source: BMWK (Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Protection)
Variables: Labour market, Development structure, Education, Infectious diseases, Infrastructure, Hospital and care data, Mobility, Public and private finances, Settlement structure, Social and political indicators, Sociodemographics, Economic data, Corona measures, Other data

Name: Regionaldatenbank Deutschland (Regional Database Germany)
Source: Statistische Ämter des Bundes und der Länder (Statistical Offices of the Federation and the Länder)
Variables: Grunddaten der KRankenhäuser, Grunddaten der Vorsorge- oder Rehabilitationseinrichtungen, Diagnosen der Krankenhauspatienten, Todesursachenstatistik
Comments: Same categories as GENESIS by DESTATIS, different variables

Name: Onkologischer Basisdatensatz 2021 (Oncology baseline dataset 2021)
Source: KKN (Klinisches Krebsregister Niedersachsen (clinical cancer registry lower saxony))
Geographical Unit: up to municipality level on request
Variables: patient data, notifier data, diagnosis, histology, TNM classification, residual status, distant metastasis, performance status, surgery, radiotherapy, side effects of radiotherapy or systemic therapy, systemic therapy, course of disease, therapy recommendation, death, comment, surgeon, genetic variant, study participation, additional contacts
